intro: Soldanella haretii, commonly known as the Haretii snowbell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly wavy margin. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
